intro: Ceropegia hadhramautica, commonly known as the Hadhramaut moon vine, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant produces nectar-rich blooms that attract specific pollinators, such as certain species of moths. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a succulent texture, adapted to store water in its native environment. Ceropegia hadhramautica is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in low-water conditions.
